description: TO AMEND S.RES. 47, ELECTION OF PRESIDENT PRO TEMPORE, BY PROVIDING THAT SENATOR VANDENBERG'S NAME BE SUBSTITUTED FOR SENATOR GLASS IN THE ELECTION OF A SENATE PRESIDENT PRO TEMPORE.

TO AMEND S. 158, A BILL TO PERMIT CONSOLIDATIONS AND MERGERS OF DOMESTIC TELEGRAPH CARRIERS, BY REDUCING FROM 5 YEARS TO 2 YEARS THE PERIOD WHICH COMPANIES CONSOLIDATING UNDER THIS LEGISLATION MUST RETAIN EMPLOYEES AFTER THE DATE OF MERGER.
TO PASS S. 158, A BILL TO PERMIT CONSOLIDATIONS AND MERGERS OF DOMESTIC TELEGRAPH CARRIERS.
NOMINATION OF JOSH LEE TO BE A MEMBER OF THE CIVIL AERO- NAUTICS BOARD.
TO REFER S. 607, OFFICE OF WAR MOBILIZATION BILL TO THE COMMITTEE ON MILITARY AFFAIRS.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 158, A BILL TO PERMIT CONSILIDATION AND MERGER OF DOMESTIC TELEGRAPH CARRIERS.
TO PASS S. 660, A BILL TO PREVENT CERTAIN DEDUCTIONS IN DETERMINING PARITY OR COMPARABLE PRICES OF AGRICULTURAL COMMODITIES.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 82, A BILL TO MAKE URGENT DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATIONS, BY CUTTING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE OFFICE OF THE TREASURER OF THE U.S. FROM $1 MILLION TO $750,000.
ON THE NOMINATION OF HARRY H. SCHWARTZ TO BE A MEMBER OF THE NATIONAL MEDIATION BOARD.
TO AMEND S. 17, A BILL TO INCREASE PAY OF POLICEMEN AND FIREMEN IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO AMEND S. 18, TEMPORARY ADJUSTMENT OF SALARIES FOR TEACHERS IN THE D. OF C., BY REDUCING INCREASE PROPOSED FOR THE PAY OF TEACHERS.
TO PASS S. 163, A BILL TO AMEND SECTION 511 OF THE MERCHANT MARINE ACT, 1936, AS AMENDED, RELATING TO SHIP- CONSTRUCTION RESERVE FUNDS, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.
TO AMEND S. 729, A BILL TO PROVIDE DEFEREMENT FROM MILITARY SERVICE OF PERSONS ENGAGED IN AGRICULTURE, BY RESTRICTING TO SOME EXTENT THE NUMBER OF PERSONS DEFERRED.
TO PASS H.R. 1501, A BILL TO EXTEND THE LEND-LEASE ACT FOR 1 YEAR.

TO AMEND S. 729, SO THAT, INSTEAD OF GRANTING OUTRIGHT DEFERMENTS TO FARM WORKERS THE AMENDMENT WOULD SET UP A "BOARD OF WAR MOBILIZATION" WHOSE DUTY IT WAS TO MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS AS TO MANPOWER MOBILIZATION.
TO RECOMMIT S. 729 TO THE COMMITTEE ON MILITARY AFFAIRS FOR FURTHER CONSIDERATION.
TO AMEND S. 729, TO PROVIDE MORE LIBERAL DEFERMENTS FOR PERSONS ENGAGED IN AGRICULTURE.
TO PASS S. 729.

TO AMEND H.R. 1780, A BILL TO PROVIDE AN INCREASE IN THE PUBLIC DEBT LIMIT--LIMITATION OF SALARIES, BY ELIMINATING THE FOLLOWING PROVISO:  "PROVIDED, THAT THE PRESIDENT MAY, WITHOUT REGARD TO THE LIMITATION CONTAINED IN CLAUSE (2), ADJUST WAGES OR SALARIS TO THE EXTENT THAT HE FINDS NECESSARY IN ANY CASE TO CORRECT GROSS INEQUITIES AND ALSO AID IN THE EFFECTIVE PROSECUTION OF THE WAR."
NOMINATION OF REAR ADMIRAL EMORY S. LAND TO BE A MEMBER OF THE MARITIME COMMISSION.
MOTION TO REFER BILL AND VETO MESSAGE TO REFER S. 660, A BILL FOR PREVENTION OF CERTAIN DEDUCTIONS, AND VETO MESSAGE OF THAT BILL TO THE COMMITTEE ON AGRICULTURE AND FORESTRY.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.J.RES. 96, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIA- TIONS TO ASSIST IN PROVIDING A SUPPLY AND DISTRIBUTION OF FARM LABOR FOR THE CALENDAR YEAR 1943.
TO PASS H.J.RES. 14, AUTHORIZING THE EXECUTION OF CERTAIN TREATY OBLIGATIONS TO PANAMA.
TO AMEND S. 796, STRIKES IN DEFENSE INDUSTRIES, BY RESTRICTING THE PRESIDENT'S ABILITY TO TAKE OVER INDUSTRIES INVOLVED IN LABOR DISTURBANCES.
TO RECOMMIT S. 796 TO THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY, WITH INSTRUCTIONS THAT THE COMMITTEE REPORT THE BILL BACK, EITHER FAVORABLY OR UNFAVORABLY, ON OR BEFORE THE 20TH DAY OF MAY.

TO AMEND S. 796, BY STRENGTHENING THE POWERS OF THE NATIONAL WAR LABOR BOARD IN DEALING WITH STRIKES.  THE PURPOSE OF THE AMENDMENT WAS TO PROVIDE A METHOD OF DEALING WITH STRIKES IN INDUSTRIES BEFORE THE NECESSITY OF THE GOVERNMENT'S TAKING OVER THE INDSTRY BECAME NECESSARY.
TO PASS S. 796, A BILL RELATING TO THE USE AND OPERATION BY THE U.S. OF CERTAIN PLANTS IN THE INTEREST OF THE NATIONAL DEFENSE.
TO AMEND S. 885, A BILL TO ESTABLISH A CIVILIAN SUPPLY ADMINISTRATION.
NOMINATION OF STEPHEN S. CHANDLER, JR., TO BE U. S. DISTRICT JUDGE FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF OKLAHOMA.
TO AMEND H.R. 2570, CURRENT PAYMENT OF INDIVIDUAL INCOME TAX, BY PROVIDING FOR A FIVE YEAR PERIOD OF WITHHOLDING FOR THE 1942 TAXES PLUS THE NORMAL CURRENT TAXES.
TO AMEND H.R. 2570, BY PROVIDING A METHOD BY WHICH 25 PERCENT OF 1942 TAXES WOULD BE RECOUPED RATHER THAN THE 13 PERCENT CONTEMPLATED IN THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT.

TO AMEND H.R. 2570, BY ALLOWING THE INCOME-TAX SYSTEM TO REMAIN IN STATUS QUO.  THE ONLY CHANGE THE AMENDMENT WOULD MAKE WOULD BE TO SET UP A COLLECTION SYSTEM COVERING INCOME TAX ON WAGES AND SALARIES.
TO AMEND H.R. 2570, BY SUBSTITUTING THE HOUSE WAYS AND MEANS COMMITTEE VERSION OF THE BILL.
TO AMEND H.R. 2570, BY ADOPTING THE HOUSE VERSION OF THE BILL AS PASSED BY THE BODY AND INCORPORATING INTO THAT BILL THE AMENDMENTS PASSED BY THE SENATE.
THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT CHANGED THE HOUSE BILL IN TWO WAYS: BY PROVIDING RELIEF FROM DOUBLED PAYMENTS AND BY PROVIDING FOR CURRENT PAYMENT FOR BASIC TAXES NOT PAID AT THE SOURCE.
TO PASS H.R. 2570.
TO AMEND H.R. 1762, INDEPENDENT OFFICES APPROPRIATIONS, BY RESTORING THE $534,000 APPROPRIATION FOR THE NATIONAL RE- SOURCES PLANNING BOARD.
TO AMEND H.R. 1762, BY MAKING A $200,000 APPROPRIATION FOR THE NATIONAL RESOURCES PLANNING BOARD.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 111, EXTENSION OF RECIPROCAL TRADE AGREEMENTS ACT, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISO-- "PROVIDED, THAT EVERY FOREIGN-TRADE AGREEMENT CONCLUDED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF SAID ACT, AS AMENDED, SHALL BE SUBJECT TO TERMINATION 6 MNTHS AFTER THE CESSATION OF HOSTILITIES IN THE PRESENT WAR AS FIXED BY PROCLAMATION OF THE PRESIDENT, PURSUANT TO JOINT RESOLUTION OF THE CONGRESS OR BY THE PRESIDENT."

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 111, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING-- "NO FOR- EIGN TRADE AGREEMENT HEREAFTER ENTERED INTO UNDER THE AU- THORITY DELEGATED TO THE PRESIDENT BY SUCH SECTION 350, AS AMENDED, NO AMENDATORY OR SUPPLEMENTARY AGREEMENT HEREAFTER ENTERED INTO UNDERSUCH SECTION, AND NO DUTIES AND OTHER IMPORT RESTRICTIONS SPECIFIED IN A PROCLAMATION ISSUED BY THE PRES

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 111, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING NEW SEC- TION:  "EFFECTIVE ON THE DATE OF ENACTMENT OF THIS ACT, SECTION 2 OF SUCH ACT OF JUNE 12, 1943, IS AMENDED BY ADDING AT THE END THEREOF THE FOLLOWING NEW SUBSECTION:  (D) NO FOREIGN TRADE AGREEMENTHEREAFTER ENTERED INTO UNDER THE FIRST SECTION OF THIS ACT SHALL TAKE EFFECT UNTIL THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES SHALL HAVE ADVISED AND CONSENTED TO ITS RATIFICATION, TWO-THIRDS OF THE SENATORS PRESENT CONCURRING."

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 111, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING:  "NO FOR- EIGN TRADE AGREEMENT HEREAFTER ENTERED INTO UNDER THE AU- THORITY DELEGATED TO THE PRESIDENT BY SUCH SECTION 350, AS AMENDED, NO AMENDATORY OR SUPPLEMENTARY AGREEMENT HEREAFTER ENTERED INTO UNDERSUCH SECTION, AND NO DUTIES AND OTHER IMPORT RESTRICTIONS SPECIFIED IN A PROCLAMATION ISSUED BY THE PRES

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 111, CONTAINING THE FOLLOWING PROVISO: "PROVIDED, THAT NO COMMODITY OR ARTICLE SHALL BE INCLUDED IN ANY FOREIGN TRADE AGREEMENT ENTERED INTO WHICH PERMITS THE ENTRY INTO AMERICAN MARKETS OF PRODUCTS OF WORKERS, FARMERS, OR MINERS OF FOEIGN COUNTRIES AT TOTAL LANDED COSTS, ALL TARIFF DUTIES PAID, WHICH TOTAL COSTS ARE LESS THAN THE COST OF PRODUCTION OR WHOLESALE SELLING PRICE OF COMPETITIVE PRODUCTS OF AMERICAN WORKERS, MINERS, OR FARMERS WHERE SUCH AMERICAN PRODUCTS ARE COMMERCIALLY A...
TO PASS H.J. RES. 111, EXTENDING THE AUTHORITY OF THE PRESI- DENT UNDER SECTION 350 OF THE TARIFF ACT OF 1930, AS AMENDED.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2570, CURRENT PAYMENT OF INDIVI- DUAL INCOME-TAX CONFERENCE REPORT, ON THE DISAGREEING VOTES OF THE TWO HOUSES ON AN AMENDMENT OF THE SENATE.
TO AMEND S. 575, CONFIRMATION BY THE SENATE OF CERTAIN GOV- ERNMENTAL EMPLOYEES, BY PROVIDING THAT ALL GOVERNMENT OFFI- CIALS WITH A SALARY OVER $4,500 MUST BE CONFIRMED BY THE SENATE.
TO AMEND H.R. 2481, AGRICULTURAL APPROPRIATIONS, BY INCREAS- ING THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR AGRICULTURAL PURPOSES BY $100,000,0009

TO DECIDE A POINT OF ORDER ON H.R. 2481.  THE POINT OF ORDER RAISED WAS THAT A PROPOSED AMENDMENT CONTAINED NEW LEGISLA- TION AND WAS THEREFORE, UNDER THE RULES OF THE SENATE, IN VIOLATION OF PARAGRAPH 2, RULE XVI.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2714, URGENT DEFICIENCY APPROPRIA- TIONS, ON A MOTION THAT THE SENATE FURTHER INSIST ON ITS AMENDMENT NO. 60 TO H.R. 2714.

TO AMEND COMMITTEE AMENDMENT, H.R. 2481, BY ADDING THE FOL- LOWING STIPULATION-- "THAT NO PART OF THE APPROPRIATION AU- THORIZED UNDER THIS ITEM SHALL BE USED EXCEPT FOR THE COMPLETE LIQUIDATION OF THE RESETTLEMENT PROJECTS WHICH SHALL BE ACCOMPLISHED BYDECEMBER 31, 1943."

TO AMEND H.R. 2481, CONCERNING RURAL REHABILITATION APPRO- PRIATIONS AND OTHER AUTHORIZED BORROWING FROM THE RECON- STRUCTION FINANCE CORPORATION TO FINANCE THE RURAL ELECTRI- FICATION ADMINISTRATION.
TO RECESS UNTIL 11 O'CLOCK JUNE 11, 1943, A MOTION MADE DUR- ING DEBATE ON H.R. 2481.

TO AMEND H.R. 2481, BY STRIKING FROM THE BILL A LIMITATION IMPOSED BY THE HOUSE, WHICH WOULD HAVE HAD THE EFFECT OF ELIMINATING AND PROHIBITING ANY LOANS MADE BY THE REGIONAL AGRICULTURAL CREDIT CORPORATION.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES SO THAT AN AMENDMENT WHICH INCLUDED LEGISLATION COULD BE OFFERED TO H.R. 2481.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 796, PREVENTION OF STRIKES IN DE- FENSE INDUSTRIES, ON THE DISAGREEING VOTES OF THE TWO HOUSES ON THE AMENDMENT OF THE HOUSE.

TO AMEND S. 575, CONFIRMATION BY THE SENATE OF CERTAIN GOV- ERNMENTAL EMPLOYEES, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISO:  "THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACT SHALL NOT BE APPLICABLE IN THE CASE OF ANY OFFICE OR POSITION IN THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AUTHORITY EXCEPT MEMBERS O THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS."

TO AMEND S. 575, BY OFFERING A SUBSTITUTE WHICH DIFFERS FROM THE COMMITTEE BILL IN THAT THE COMMITTEE BILL USED A SALARY AS THE STANDARD TO DETERMINE WHICH EMPLOYEES SHOULD BE CON- FIRMED BY THE SENATE-- THE SUBSTITUTE USES A DEFINITION OF WHAT CONSTITUTS A POLICY-MAKING OFFICER OF THE GOVERNMENT.
TO REFER S. 575 TO THE COMMITTEE ON CIVIL SERVICE.

TO PASS S. 575, A BILL TO PROVIDE THAT CERTAIN CIVILIAN OF- FICERS IN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH OF THE GOVERNMENT WHO ARE APPOINTED WITHOUT REGARD TO THE CIVIL-SERVICE LAWS SHALL BE APPOINTED BY THE PRESIDENT, BY AND WITH THE ADVICE AND CON- SENT OF THE SENAT.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2714, URGENT DEFICIENCY APPROPRIA- TIONS, ON THE DISAGREEING VOTES OF THE TWO HOUSES ON AN AMENDMENT OF THE SENATE.
TO OVERRIDE VETO ON S. 796, PREVENTION OF STRIKES IN DEFENSE INDUSTRIES.

TO AMEND S. 1108, CONTINUATION OF COMMODITY CREDIT, BY NE- GATING THE CLAIM OF THE LOAN ADMINISTRATOR AND THE OFFICE OF PRICE ADMINISTRATION THAT SECTION 2 (E) OF THE STABILIZA- TION ACT GAVE THEM AUTHORITY FOR THE ROLL-BACK POLICY THEY WERE PURSUING.  TE AMENDMENT ALSO PROVIDED THAT WHATEVER WAS ACCOMPLISHED IN THE WAY OF SUBSIDIES SHOULD BE SPECIF- ICALLY AUTHORIZED BY AN ACT OF CONGRESS.
TO AMEND S. 1108, BY PROVIDING A GENERAL SUBSTITUTE FOR THE SUBSIDY PROGRAM INCLUDED IN THE ORIGINAL LEGISLATION.
TO AMEND H.R. 2935, APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE LABOR DEPARTMENT AND FEDERAL SECUIRTY AGENCY, BY CALLING FOR THE APPROPRIA- TION OF $48,800,000 TO CONTINUE THE NATIONAL YOUTH PROGRAM.
TO TABLE MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH AN AMEND- MENT TO H.R. 2935, OFFERED BY SENATOR TRUMAN WAS AGREED TO; SEE REF. #0073.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2481,  APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DE- PARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, ON A MOTION THAT THE SENATE INSIST UPON ITS AMENDMENT NUMBERED 87.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2481, ON A MOTION THAT THE SENATE INSIST UPON ITS AMENDMENT 98 AND 99.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2714, URGENT DEFICIENCY APPROPRIA- TIONS, ON THE DISAGREEING VOTES OF THE TWO HOUSES ON CERTAIN AMENDMENTS OF THE SENATE.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2714, URGENT DEFICIENCY APPROPRIA- TIONS, ON THE DISAGREEING VOTES OF THE TWO HOUSES ON CERTAIN AMENDMENTS OF THE SENATE.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2869,  CONTINUATION OF COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION, ON THE DISAGREEING VOTES OF THE TWO HOUSES ON THE AMENDMENT OF THE SENATE.

TO AMEND H.R. 2938,  APPROPRIATIONS FOR WAR AGENCIES IN THE EXECUTIVE OFFICE, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE MOTION PICTURE BUREAU, THE BOOK AND MAGAZINE DIVISIONS, THE FIELD SERVICE, AND THE BUREAU OF GRAPHICS AND PRINTING.
TO AMEND H.R. 2968,  APPROPRIATIONS FOR WAR AGENCIES IN THE EXECUTIVE OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT, BY INCREASING THE APPRO- PRIATION FOR CIVIL DEFENSE FROM $4,000,000 TO $5,000,000.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2481,  APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DE- PARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, THAT THE SENATE RECEDE FROM ITS AMENDMENTS NUMBERED 98 AND 99.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2714, URGENT DEFICIENCY APPROPRIA- TIONS, ON THE DISAGREEING VOTES OF THE TWO HOUSES ON CERTAIN AMENDMENTS OF THE SENATE.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2935, DEPARTMENT OF LABOR AND FEDERAL SECURITY AGENCY APPROPRIATIONS, ON THE DISAGREEING VOTES OF THE TWO HOUSES ON CERTAIN AMENDMENTS OF THE SENATE.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2935, ON A MOTION THAT THE SENATE CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT OF THE HOUSE TO SENATE AMENDMENT NUMBERED 19.  THE HOUSE AMENDMENT PROVIDED THAT "NO PART OF THE FUNDS APPROPRIATED IN THIS TITLE SHALL BE USED IN ANY WAY IN CONNECTION WTH A COMPLAINT CASE ARISING OVER AN AGREEMENT BETWEEN MANAGEMENT AND LABOR WHICH HAS BEEN IN EX- ISTENCE 3 MONTHS OR LONGER WITHOUT COMPLAINT BEING FILED."

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2935, THAT THE SENATE RECEDE FROM SENATE AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT ALL APPOINTMENTS INVOLVING SALARIES OF $4,500 OR MORE MADE BY THE PRESIDENT UNDER THE APPROPRIATION BILL SHOULD BE CONFIRMED BY THE SENATE.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2935, THAT THE SENATE RECEDE FROM AN AMENDMENT MAKING APPROPRIATION TO CONTINUE THE NATIONAL YOUTH ADMINISTRATION.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2481, THAT THE SENATE RECEDE FROM AMENDMENTS NOS. 98 AND 99, RELATING TO THE FEDERAL CROP INSURANCE AND TO THE AGRICULTURAL APPROPRIATIONS UNDER H.R. 2481.
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 147, CONTINUATION OF COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION, DEALING WITH PAYMENT OF SUBSIDIES ON AGRICUL- TURAL PRODUCE.
TO RECONSIDER SENATOR TAFT'S AMENDMENT TO A COMMITTEE AMEND- MENT TO H.J. RES. 147.  THE AMENDMENT CONTAINED PROVISIONS AGAINST GRADE LABELING AND THE ELIMINATION OF TRADE NAMES.
THIS VOTE IS THE RECONSIDERATION OF A COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.J. RES. 147.  THE AMENDMENT DEALS WITH PAYMENT OF SUB- SIDIES BEING RECONSIDERED.
TO PASS H.J. RES. 147, CONTINUATION OF THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION AS AN AGENCY OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH H.J. RES. 147 WAS REJECTED.
TO RECOMMIT H.J. RES. 147 TO THE COMMITTEE ON BANKING AND CURRENCY WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT BACK NOT LATER THAN 12 O'CLOCK NOON JULY 7, 1943.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 147, BY PROVIDING FOR AN APPROPRIATION FOR THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION BY RESTRICTING THE SUBSIDY PAYMENTS UNDER THE APPROPRIATION TO THOSE SPECIFI- CALLY PROVIDED IN THE STATUTE.

TO PASS H.R. 2936, A BILL TO AUTHORIZE THE APPROPRIATION OF AN ADDITIONAL $200,000,000 TO CARRY OUT THE PROVISIONS OF TITLE II OF THE ACT ENTITLED "AN ACT TO EXPEDITE THE PROVISION OF HOUSING IN CONNECTION WITH NATIONAL DEFENSE, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES,"APROVED OCT
CONFERENCE INSTRUCTIONS, ON H.J. RES. 147, THAT THE SENATE CONFEREES BE INSTRUCTED TO RECEDE FROM SENATE AMENDMENT NUMBERED 3.

TO AMEND H.R. 1203, ELIMINATION OF PRIVATE SUITS ARISING OUT OF FRAUDS AGAINST THE UNITED STATES, BY PERMITTING AN INFOR- MER OR PERSON HAVING KNOWLEDGE OF FRAUD IN THE CASE OF A GOVERNMENT CONTRACT TO FIRST GO TO THE ATTORNEY GENERAL WITH THE INFORMATIO, AND IF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL FAILS TO BRING SUIT WITHIN 6 MONTHS, THE INFORMER CAN BRING SUIT ON BEHALF OF HIMSELF AND THE UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT AGAINST THE OFFENDING PARTY.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 1203 TO THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 1203 TO THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO HOLD HEARINGS ON IT AND TO REPORT IT BACK TO THE SENATE NOT LATER THAN DECEMBER 1, 1943.
TO AMEND H.R. 1203, BY ELIMINATING THE RETROACTIVE FEATURE OF THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT BY PERMITTING A STAY AT THE IN- SISTENCE OF THE GOVERNMENT.
TO AMEND S. 763, DEFERMENT OF FATHERS FROM THE DRAFT, BY IN- CREASING FAMILY ALLOTMENTS OF SERVICEMEN.

TO AMEND S. 763, BY PROVIDING THAT SUBSTANTIALLY ALL SINGLE MEN MUST BE CALLED BEFORE ANY MARRIED MEN ARE CALLED.  IT FURTHER PROVIDES THAT SUBSTANTIALLY ALL MARRIED MEN WHO ARE NOT FATHERS MUST BE CALLED BEFORE FATHERS ARE CALLED. IT GOES ON TO PROVIDE HAT THE YOUNGER FATHERS MUST BE CALLED FIRST IN THE GROUP FROM 18 TO 25, AND AFTER THAT FROM 25 TO 30, AND FINALLY FROM 30 TO 38.

TO AMEND S. 763 BY THE FOLLOWING PROVISO:  "THAT FATHERS BE DEFERRED UNTIL SUCH TIME AS THE SELECTIVE SERVICE HAS DETER- MINED AND INDUCTED INTO THE ARMED SERVICES THE NUMBER OF MEN NOW DEFERRED IN GOVERNMENT AND INDUSTRY THAT WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR CALL NDER THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ACT AND THE NUMBER OF MEN IN THE IV-F CLASSIFICATION WHO CAN BE INDUCTED INTO THE ARMED SERVICES BY A REVIEW OF THE PHYSICAL STAND- ARDS AS MAY BE RECOMMENDED BY THE COMMISSION ESTABLISHED BY THE PRESIDENT FOR THE PURPOSE OF EX...
TO PASS S. 763, A DEFERMENT OF FATHERS FROM THE DRAFT.

TO AMEND S. 637, FEDERAL AID TO PUBLIC EDUCATION, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISO:  "PROVIDED, THAT THERE SHALL BE NO DISCRIMINATION IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF BENEFITS AND APPROPRIATIONS MADE UNDER THE RESPECTIVE PROVISIONS OF THIS ACT, OR IN THE STATES FNDS SUPPLEMENTED THEREBY ON ACCOUNT OF RACE, CREED, OR COLOR."
TO RECOMMIT S. 637 TO THE COMMITTEE ON EDUCATION AND LABOR.
TO AMEND S. RES. 192, COLLABORATION FOR POST-WAR PEACE, BY STATING THE MINIMUM TERMS TO BE INCLUDED IN ANY AGREEMENT FOR PEACE FOR THE GUIDANCE OF THE PRESIDENT.
TO AMEND S. RES. 192, BY DECLARING THAT THE UNITED STATES PARTICIPATION IN ANY INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATION SHOULD BE BY TREATY ONLY.
TO PASS S. RES. 192, WHICH DECLARES WAR AND PEACE AIMS OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO AMEND S. 1457, PROMOTION OF GOVERNMENT BOND SALES BY NEWSPAPER ADVERTISING, BY REQUIRING THAT $5,000,000 OF THE APPROPRIATION BE SPENT FOR ADVERTISING BY SMALL RADIO STATIONS.
TO AMEND S. 1457, BY STRIKING FROM THE LEGISLATION THE RE- QUIREMENT THAT THE AUTHORIZED APPROPRIATION BE SPENT.
TO PASS S. 1457, A BILL TO AID IN THE STABILIZATION PROGRAM AND THE WAR EFFORT BY PAID NEWSPAPER ADVERTISING IN CONNEC- TION WITH THE SALE OF UNITED STATES BONDS, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.
TO OVERRIDE VETO OF S. 514, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE RELIEF OF BLANCHE H. KARSCH, ADMINISTRATRIX OF THE ESTATE OF KATE E. HAMILTON.

TO AMEND S. 1285, WARTIME METHOD OF VOTING BY ARMED FORCES, BY CHANGING THE WAY IN WHICH THE BALLOT COMMISSION PROVIDED UNDER THE LEGISLATION SHOULD BE CREATED.  IT PROVIDES THAT THE RESPECTIVE NATIONAL COMMITTEES SHALL SUBMIT NO LESS THAN SIX NOMINEES FOM WHOM TWO WOULD BE SELECTED TO SERVE
MOTION THAT THE SENATE PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF EXECUTIVE BUSINESS.
TO RECONSIDER SENATOR BRIDGES' AMENDMENT TO S. 1285.  THE AMENDMENT PROVIDED A NEW METHOD BY WHICH TO CHOOSE THE MEM- BERS OF A BALLOT COMMISSION WHICH WAS CREATED.
RECONSIDERATION OF THE BRIDGES AMENDMENT TO S. 1285. SEE REF. #0115.
TO TABLE A MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH AN AMEND- MENT TO S. 1285 CHANGING THE METHOD OF CHOOSING A BALLOT COMMISSION UNDER THIS LEGISLATION WAS ACCEPTED.

TO AMEND S. 1285 BY PROVIDING THAT THE MEMBERS OF THE MER- CHANT MARINE WOULD REMAIN WITHIN THE PROVISIONS OF THE MEASURE, AND WOULD BE ENTITLED TO VOTE, BUT ELIMINATING CERTAIN CIVILIANS IN THE MERCHANT MARINE ORIGINALLY COVERED IN THE LEGISLATION.

TO AMEND S. 1285, BY PROVIDING FOR THE INCLUSION OF THE FOL- LOWING UNDER THE TERMS OF THE ACT:  THE AMERICAN RED CROSS, THE SOCIETY OF FRIENDS, THE WOMEN'S AUXILIARY FERRY SERVICE, THE WOMEN'S AIR FORCE SERVICE PILOTS, AND THE UNITED STATES SERVICE ORGAIZATIONS OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES WHO ARE ATTACHED TO AND SERVING WITH THE ARMED FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES.
THE AMENDMENT WOULD HAVE PLACED THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR DETERMINING THE TYPE OF POLITICAL LITERATURE SUPPLIED TO SERVICEMENT OVERSEAS TO THE WAR DEPARTMENT AND THE NAVY DEPARTMENT.

TO AMEND S. 1285 BY ATTEMPTING TO PREVENT THE DISTRIBUTION OF PARTISAN PROPAGANDA TO SERVICEMENT OVERSEAS BY ALLOWING THE BI-PARTISAN BALLOT COMMISSION CREATED UNDER THE ACT TO ACT AS A SCREENING AGENT.

TO AMEND S. 1285, BY CHANGING THE MECHANISM FOR VOTING UNDER THE ACT.  IT WOULD AUTHORIZE THE ABSENTEE VOTER TO DESIG- NATE, THROUGH POWER OF ATTORNEY, TO HIS FATHER, MOTHER, RELATIVE, OR TRUSTED FRIEND, THE AUTHORITY TO VOTE IN BEHALF OF THE ABSENTEE VOER AND IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE LATTER'S INSTRUCTIONS, PRECISELY AS THOUGH HE WERE PRESENT IN PERSON WITHIN THE APPROPRIATE VOTING PRECINCT OF HIS INDIVIDUAL STATE.
TO AMEND S. 1285, BY REQUIRING THAT THE METHOD FOR ABSENTEE VOTING MUST BE PROVIDED AND REGULATED BY THE STATES RATHER THAN THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT.

TO AMEND H.R. 3598, FIRST SUPPLEMENTAL NATIONAL DEFENSE AP- PROPRIATIONS, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING-- "THE AMOUNT THAT MAY BE USED FOR ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES IN THE FISCAL YEAR 1944 UNDER THE HEAD "WAR SHIPPING ADMINISTRATION, REVOLVING FUND" IS HEREBY INREASED FROM $9,650,000 TO $12,000,000.

TO SUSPEND SENATE RULES TO ALLOW AN AMENDMENT MAKING LEGIS- LATION IN AN APPROPRIATION BILL.  THE PROPOSED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3598 WOULD HAVE SEVERELY RESTRICTED THE TRANSFER OF SURPLUS FUNDS THAT MIGHT HAVE ACCRUED WITHIN THE WAR DEPARTMENT.

TO AMEND H.R. 3598, BY PROVIDING THAT THE SECRETARY OF WAR MAY TRANSFER UP TO 10 PER CENT OF ANY OR ALL OF THE APPRO- PRIATIONS FOR THE MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 1944 TO ANY OTHER SUCH APPROPRIATION, BUT NO OTHER APPROPRIATION SHOULD BE NCREASED MORE THAN 10 PER CENT THEREBY.

TO AMEND H.R. 3598, BY PROVIDING THAT IF A SURPLUS DEVELOPS IN ANY PARTICULAR ACTIVITY OF THE WAR DEPARTMENT, SUCH SUR- PLUS SHOUD BE IMPOUNDED BY THE SECRETARY OF WAR, AND THAT IT COULD BE EXPENDED THEREAFTER ONLY FOR THE PURPOSE FOR WHICH IT WAS ORIGINLLY APPROPRIATED

TO SUSPEND SENATE RULES SO AS TO ALLOW AN AMENDMENT MAKING LEGISLATION IN AN APPROPRIATION BILL.  THE PROPOSED AMEND- MENT TO H.R. 3598 WOULD HAVE ADDED AN APPROPRIATION FOR THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE IN AN ATTEMPT TO REMEDY THE SERIOUS SHORTAGE OF DENTISS AND PHYSICIANS.
TO PASS H.J. RES. 91, PAY OF NONOPERATING RAILWAY EMPLOYEES.

TO AMEND H.R. 3687, THE REVENUE ACT, BY PROVIDING THAT ONE YEAR FROM JANUARY 1, 1944, PAY-ROLL TAXES FOR OLD-AGE AND SURVIVORS' BENEFITS BE FROZEN AT EXISTING RATES OF 1 PERCENT UPON EMPLOYERS AND 1 PERCENT UPON EMPLOYEES, INSTEAD BEING INCREASED TO 2 PECENT ON EMPLOYERS AND EMPLOYEES AS WOULD OTHERWISE BE REQUIRED BY THE EXISTING SOCIAL SECURITY LAW.

TO AMEND H.R. 3687, BY PROVIDING THAT IN THE YEAR IN WHICH A TAX LOSS IS CLAIMED BY AN INDIVIDUAL FROM THE OPERATION OF A 'COLLATERAL VENTURE', THE COMMISSIONER OF INTERNAL REVENUE WOULD BE AUTHORIZED TO COMPUTE THE INCOME OF THE PARTICULAR INDIVIDUAL FO EACH OF 5 YEARS
TO AMEND H.R. 3687, BY SUSPENDING FOR THE DURATION OF THE WAR THE 10 CENTS PER POUND TAX ON COLORED OLEOMARGARINE.
TO AMEND. H.R. 3687, BY STRIKING FROM THE BILL A MEASURE WHICH WOULD HAVE DEPRIVED A NUMBER OF METALS AND MINERAL OF THE DEPLETION ALLOWANCE AFTER THE CLOSE OF THE WAR.
TO TABLE A MOTION TO AMEND H.R. 3687, WHICH STRIKES FROM THE BILL A MEASURE DEPRIVING A NUMBER OF METALS AND MINERALS OF THE DEPLETION ALLOWANCE AFTER THE CLOSE OF THE WAR.
TO AMEND H.R. 3687, BY REQUIREING THAT THE BENEFICIARIES OF TAX EXEMPTION PRIVILEGES, SUCH AS FARM COOPERATIVES OR LABOR UNION, FILE A TAX RETURN FOR THE YEAR 1943 TO PROVE THE EXEMPTION JUSTIFIABLE.

TO AMEND H.R. 3687, BY STRIKING FROM THE BILL A PROVISION WHICH REQUIRES INCOME-TAX RETURNS FROM CERTAIN ORGANIZATIONS WHICH ARE EXEMPT UNDER LAW FROM PAYING INCOME TAXES, SUCH AS FARM COOPERATIVES AND LABOR UNIONS.
TO AMEND H.R. 3687, BY STRIKING FROM THE BILL CERTAIN PRO- VISIONS RELATING TO THE FILING OF INCOME-TAX RETURNS BY CERTAIN FARM COOPERATIVES.

TO AMEND H.R. 3687, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING:  "IN DETERMINING EXCESSIVE PROFITS UNDER THE RENEGOTIATION ACT, FOR FISCAL YEARS ENDING PRIOR TO JULY 1, 1943, AMOUNTS PAID PRIOR TO SUCH DETERMINATION WITH RESPECT TO TAXES IMPOSED BY ANY STATE, TERRITORY, ORPOLITICAL SUBDIVISION THEREOF, WHICH ARE MEASURED BY INCOME, SHALL TO THE EXTENT SO PAID BE ALLOWED AS ITEMS OF COST."
TO CONSIDER H.R. 3477, A BILL PROVIDING FOR CONTINUATION OF THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION.

TO AMEND S. 1612, A BILL TO AMEND THE ACT OF SEPT 1942, WHICH PROVIDED A WARTIME METHOD OF VOTING BY THE MEMBERS OF THE ARMED FORCES, BY REQUIRING THAT ANY VOTING PROVISION FOR MEMBER OF THE AMNED FORCES BE "IN ACCORDANCE WITH STATE LAW."
TO AMEND S. 1612, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING:  "QUALIFICATIONS OF THE VOTERS SHALL BE DETERMINED BY LAW."

TO AMEND S. 1612, BY PROVIDING FOR A FEDERAL BALLOT ONLY IN THOSE CASES WHERE THE STATES THEMSELVES FAILED TO PROVIDE A PRACTICAL MEANS FOR A SOLDIER TO VOTE.  THIS WOULD APPLY ONLY TO SOLDIERS SERVING WITHIN THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND S. 1612, BY PROVIDING THAT SOLDIERS WHO ARE ABROAD SHOULD HAVE THEIR STATE BALLOTS AND THAT THEY SHOULD NOT HAVE FEDERAL BALLOTS UNLESS THE STATE FROM WHICH THEY COME FAILS TO PROVIDE AN ABSENTEE VOTERS' LAW.
TO AMEND S. 1612, BY ALLOWING ALL SOLDIERS TO VOTE IRRESPECTIVE OF AGE.
TO AMEND S. 1612, BY REQUIRING THE VOTER USING THE FEDERAL BALLOT TO INSERT THE NAME OF THE CANDIDATE INSTEAD OF MERELY WRITING IN THE NAME OF THE PARTY.
TO  CONSIDER A HOUSE MESSAGE ON S. 1285, A BILL TO PROVIDE A WARTIME METHOD OF VOTING BY THE MEMBERS OF THE ARMED FORCES.
TO CONSIDER HOUSE MESSAGE ON S. 1285.

TO AMEND S. 1612, BY DOING AWAY WITH ONE ENTIRE MAILING OF THE BALLOT PROCEDURE AND WOULD ALSO DO AWAY WITH BURDENING THE ARMY AND NAVY WITH THE TRANSPORTATION OF BALLOTS, AND WOULD PLACE THAT BURDEN LARGELY ON THE POST OFFICE DEPARTMENT.
TO CONSIDER HOUSE AMENDMENTS TO S. 1285.
TO AMEND S. 1285, BY PROVIDING THAT IF FOR ANY REASON AN INDIVIDUAL OVERSEAS WERE UNABLE TO VOTE ON A STATE BALLOT HE COULD THEN VOTE ON THE FEDERAL BALLOT.
TO AMEND S. 1285 BY PROVIDING A SUBSTITUTE A METHOD OF ABSENTEE VOTING FOR THAT PROVIDED IN THE PROPOSED SENATE AMENDMENT TO THE BILL AS PASSED BY THE HOUSE.
TO AMEND S. 1285, BY PROVIDING FOR A FEDERAL BALLOT IN THOSE CASES WHERE THE STATES FAIL TO PROVIDE AN ABSENTEE VOTING LAW.
TO AMEND S. 1285, BY PROVIDING A SUBSTITUTE METHOD OF ABSENTEE VOTING FOR THAT PROVIDED IN THE BARKLEY AMENDMENT TO THE BILL AS PASSED BY THE HOUSE.
TO PASS S. 1612, A BILL TO AMEND THE ACT OF SEPT. 16, 1942, WHICH PROVIDED A METHOD OF WARTIME VOTING BY MEMBERS OF THE ARMED FORCES.

TO AMEND H.R. 3477, A BILL FOR CONTINUATION OF THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION, BY PROVIDING FOR A SERIES OF AGRICULTURAL SUBSIDIES UP TO $1.5 BILLION FOR THE PURPOSE OF OBTAINING NEEDED PRODUCTION OR DISTRIBUTION OF A COMMODITY CONSISTENTLY WITH THE OBECTIVES OF THE EMERGENCY PRICE CONTROL ACT OF 1942 AND THE STABLIZATION ACT.
TO AMEND H.R. 3477, BY CHANGING THE PROGRAM FROM A SO-CALLED 'CONSUMER SUBSIDY' TO A PRICE SUPPORT PROGRAM AND WOULD REDUCE THE AUTHORIZATION FROM $1.5 BILLION TO $950 MILLION.
TO AMEND H.R. 3477, BY PROVIDING FOR REIMBURSING FARMERS FOR ANY LOSS WHICH THEY MIGHT SUSTAIN BY REASON OF THE ABOLITION OF SUBSIDIES AND PERMIT THEM TO CONTINUE IN PRODUCTION.

TO AMEND H.R. 3477, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING:  "IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE STABILIZATION ACT, APPROVED OCTOBER 2, 1942, THE PRESIDENT SHALL ISSUE A GENERAL ORDER WITH RESPECT TO WAGES AND SALARIES, PERMITTING ANY INCREASE IN STRAIGHT-TIME HOURLY EARNING WHICH DOES NOT RESULT IN INCREASING SUCH EARNINGS TO A POINT MORE THAN 18 PERCENT ABOVE THE LEVEL OF JAN
TO AMEND H.R. 3477, BY ELIMINATING ALL SUBSIDIES--THE SUPPOSEDLY "GOOD" ONES AS WELL AS THE "BAD" ONES.
TO PASS H.R. 3477.

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 192, A BILL ALLOWING THE U.S. TO PARTICI- PATE IN THE UNITED NATIONS RELIEF AND REHABILITATION ADMINISTRATION BY PROVIDING THAT 50 PER CENT OF THE MONEY AUTHORIZED FOR THIS UNITED NATIONS AGENCY SHOULD BE SPENT FOR THE PURCHASE OF FARM RODUCTS AND OTHER SUPPLIES IN THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 192, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISO: "NONE OF THE FUNDS APPRIPRIATED IN PURSUANCE OF THIS AUTHORIZATION SHALL BE EXPENDED IN THE PROMOTION OF ANY EDU- CATIONAL, RELIGIOUS, OR POLITICAL PROGRAM IN ANY COUNTRY IN WHICH REHABILITATION IS ARRIED ON."
TO PASS H.J.RES. 192.
TO PASS H.R. 149, A BILL TO FIX A STANDARD OF IDENTITY OF DRY MILK SOLIDS.
TO OVERIDE VETO OF H.R. 3687, THE REVENUE ACT.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 1285, WARTIME METHOD OF VOTING BY MEMBERS OF THE ARMED FORCES.

TO AMEND COMMITTEE AMENDMENT H.R. 4070, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE FEDERAL COMMUNICATIONS COMMISSION FROM $4,191,143 TO $6,146,000.
TO AMEND H.R. 4070, BY RESTORING AN $500,000 APPROPRIATION FOR THE FOREIGN BROADCAST INTELLIGENCE SERVICE.  THIS AGENCY PERFORMED THE WORK OF MONITORING FOREIGN BROADCASTS.
TO RECOMMIT H.J.RES. 192, UNITED NATIONS RELIEF AND REHABILITATION ADMINISTRATION, TO CONFERENCE COMMITTEE.
TO PASS CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.J. RES 192,  UNITED NATIONS RELIEF AND REHABILITATION ADMINISTRATION.

TO SUSTAIN A RULE OF THE CHAIR THAT A POINT OF ORDER RAISED BY SENATOR TYDINGS THAT THE QUESTION OF GERMANENESS OF AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 4070, SHOULD BE SUBMITTED TO THE SENATE WAS OUT OF ORDER AT THE TIME IT WAS MADE.

TO AMEND H.R. 4070 BY REQUIRING THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AUTHORITY TO TURN ALL ITS RECEIPTS QUARTERLY INTO THE TREASURY, AFTER WHICH AN APPROPRIATION IS TO BE MADE TO PORVIDE MONEY FOR THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AUTHORITY.
TO AMEND H.R. 4070, BY CERTAIN PERFECTING AMENDMENTS CORRECTIN THE WORDING OF THE MEASURE.
TO AMEND H.R. 4070, BY PROVIDING FOR THE RETENTION OF THE FAIR EMPLOYMENT PRACTICE COMMITTEE.
AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 4070, PROVIDING FOR THE RETENTION OF THE FAIR EMPLOYMENT PRACTICE COMMITTEE.

TO AMEND H.R. 4070, BY PROVIDING FOR THE RETENTION OF THE FAIR EMPLOYMENT PRACTICE COMMITTEE.  (THIS AMENDMENT WAS PREVIOUSLY AGREED TO, BUT A MOTION TO RECONSIDER WAS SUCCESSFUL.  THIS ROLL CALL IS THE RECONSIDERATION OF THE AMENDMENT.)
TO TABLE A MOTION TO RECONSIDER, H.R. 4070, AN AMENDMENT ABOLISHING FROM CIVIL SERVICE REQUIREMENTS ALL POSITIONS WITH SALARIES OF $4,500 OR MORE A YEAR.

TO SUSPEND SENATE RULE, H.R. 4070, IN ORDER TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT TO HR 4070 WHICH WOULD BRING UNDER THE COMP- TROLLER GENERAL'S OFFICE THOSE AGENCIES OF GOVERNMENT WHICH WERE NOT REQUIRED TO MAKE TO THE CONGRESS PROPER ACCOUNTING OF THEIR FUNDS.
TO PASS S. 1767, A BILL TO PROVIDE FEDERAL AID FOR READJUSTMENT OF WORLD WAR II VETERANS IN CIVIL LIFE.

TO AMEND S. 683, RECOGNITION OF SERVICES OF CIVILIAN EMPLOYEES IN CONNECTION WITH THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE PANAMA CANAL, BY LIMITING COMPENSATION TO THOSE SUFFERING FROM DISABILITY RESULTING FROM PERSONAL INJURIES SUSTAINED OR ILLNESS CONTRACTED DURING TH CONSTRUCTION OF THE CANAL.

TO CONSIDER H.R. 3931, A BILL AUTHORIZING THE CONSTRUCTION, REPAIR, AND PRESERVATION OF CERTAIN PUBLIC WORKS ON RIVERS AND HARBORS, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.

TO AMEND S. 1764, EXTENSION OF EMERGENCY PRICE CONTROL AND STABILIZATION ACTS, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISO:  "AFTER JUNE 30, 1945, NEITHER THE PRICE ADMINISTRATOR NOR THE RFC NOR ANY OTHER GOVERNMENT CORPORATION SHALL MAKE ANY SUBSIDY PAYMENTS, OR BU ANY COMMODITIES FOR THE PURPOSE OF DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY THE SALE OF COMMODITIES, UNLESS THE MONEY REQUIRED FOR SUCH SUBSIDIES, OR SALE AT A LOSS, HAS BEEN APPROPRIATED BY CONGRESS FOR SUCH PURPOSE."

TO AMEND COMMITTEE AMENDMENT S. 1764, EXTENSION OF EMERGENCY PRICE CONTROL AND STABILIZATION ACTS, BY INCREASING THE PERIOD IN WHICH A PERSON COULD FILE A PROTEST AGAINST THE ORDERS AND REGULATIONS TO 60 DAYS.
TO AMEND S. 1764, BY EXTENDING TO CIVIL SUITS AND INJUNCTION PROCEEDINGS THE DEFENSES AND PROTECTIONS WHICH SECTION 107 OF THE ACT PROVIDES IN CRIMINAL PROCEEDINGS.

TO AMEND S. 1764 BY LIMITING POWERS OF THE WAR PRODUCTION BOARD TO CONTROL PRICES.  THIS AMENDMENT ESPECIALLY RELATED TO COTTON GOODS.

TO AMEND H.R. 4879 A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR DEPARTMENT OF LABOR, FEDERAL SECURITY AGENCY, AND RELATED INDEPENDENT AGENCIES, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FOR STATE UNEMPLOYMENT AGENCIES FROM $25,000,000 TO $31,000,000.

TO AMEND H.R. 4879 BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISO: "PROVIDED FURTHER, THAT NO PART OF THE FUNDS HEREIN APPROPRIATED SHALL BE USED TO PAY THE COMPENSATION OF ANY PERSON EMPLOYED BY SAID COMMITTEE ON FIAR EMPLOYMENT PRACTICE WHO ISSUES OR ATTEMPTS TO ENFOCE ANY RULE, REGULATION, OR ORDER WHICH REPEALS, AMENDS, OR MODIFIES ANY LAW ENACTED BY CONGRESS."

TO AMEND H.R. 4879, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVIS0: "PROVIDED THAT NOT MORE THAN 25 PER CENT OF THE PART OF THIS APPROPRIATION WHICH IS USED FOR THE PAYMENT OF COMPEN- SATION FOR PERSONAL SERVICES SHALL BE USED FOR THE PAYMENT OF COMPENSATION OF PERSONSWHO ARE MEMBERS OF ANY RACE COMPRISING LESS THAN 15 PER CENT OF THE TOTAL POPULATION OF THE U.S., ACCORDING TO THE 1940 CENSUS."
